title: Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign
deleted: Trump has pledged to decrease energy and electricity prices by half within 12 months of taking back the White House.<ref>[https://www.dailywire.com/news/trump-vows-to-slash-energy-prices-50-in-12-months-if-elected Trump Vows To Slash Energy Prices 50% In 12 Months If Elected] Leif Le Mahieu, Sep 24, 2024, DailyWire </ref> He argued that the price target would be achieved by producing more energy, adding that cheaper energy would make everything else cheaper.<ref>[https://justthenews.com/politics-policy/energy/drill-baby-drill-trump-touts-energy-production-drive-down-prices 'Drill baby drill': Trump touts energy production to drive down prices] Ben Whedon, Sep 27, 2024, Just The News </ref>

title: Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign
added: {{As of|2024|October}}, the Trump campaign has asked to travel by military aircraft and other increased security measures. President Biden said he gave instructions for Trump to have the highest possible level of security, as if he were "a sitting president."<ref>{{Cite web |last=Holmes |first=Kristen |last2=Lybrand |first2=Holmes |last3=Collins |first3=Kaitlan |date=2024-10-11 |title=Trump campaign asks for military aircraft with antimissile capabilities and other security measures in lead-up to election |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2024/10/11/politics/donald-trump-security-requests/index.html |access-date=2024-10-12 |website=CNN |language=en}}</ref>

title: Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign
added: Trump has called for the death penalty for migrants who kill American citizens and law enforcement officers.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/trump-calls-death-penalty-migrants-kill-us-citizens-rcna175131|title=Trump calls for death penalty for migrants who kill U.S. citizens|work=|date=12 October 2024 |access-date=19 October 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/12/trump-calls-for-death-penalty-for-migrants-who-kill-us-citizens-police|title=Trump calls for death penalty for migrants who kill US citizens, police|work=|date=12 October 2024 |access-date=19 October 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/us/trump-expected-play-up-fears-venezuelan-gang-aurora-colorado-2024-10-11/|title=Trump calls for death penalty for migrants who kill Americans|work=|date=12 October 2024 |access-date=19 October 2024}}</ref>

title: Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign

title: Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign
deleted: The election was stolen trump cheated.

title: Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign
added: {{see also|Economic policy of the first Donald Trump administration}}

title: Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign
deleted: During Musk's first campaign appearance with Donald Trump in October 2024, he urged the crowd to register to vote, portraying Democrats as a threat to democracy. Speaking at a rally in [[Butler, Pennsylvania|Butler]], Musk stressed the urgency of voter registration, claiming the upcoming election was crucial for protecting free speech and constitutional rights. Trump, addressing the audience, referenced a recent assassination attempt against him and accused his opponents of trying to thwart his efforts. The rally featured several prominent speakers, all echoing the sentiment that this election was critical for the future of the country, while investigations into threats against Trump remained ongoing.<ref>{{cite news|last=Strauss |first=Daniel |title=Musk casts Democrats as a threat in first trail appearance with Trump  |date=2024-10-05 |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2024/10/05/politics/musk-trump-rally-butler/index.html |access-date=2024-10-07}}</ref>

title: Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign
added: By the end of Trump's presidential campaign, [[Elon Musk]] had spent $277 million to elect Trump and allied Republicans, making the largest individual political donor of the 2024 election and the largest individual political donor since at least 2010 outside of candidates funding their own campaigns according to [[OpenSecrets]]. Musk's donations primarily went to his Super Pac, America PAC, and ran what ''The Washington Post'' described as most significant get-out-the-vote operation for Trump. Musk also gave $20.5 million to an "RGB PAC" that sought to use the name of former Supreme Court Justice [[Ruth Bader Ginsberg]] to convince voters that Trump would not sign a national abortion ban. He also launched a $1 million a day giveaway for swing state voters the Justice Department warned could potentially violate federal election laws. Musk beat Trump's second largest donor, Timothy Mellon, by roughly $80 million.<ref>{{Cite news |last1=Thadani |first1=Trisha |last2=Morse |first2=Clara Ence |date=December 6, 2024 |title=Elon Musk is now America's largest political donor |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2024/12/06/elon-musk-trump-campaign-spending-fec/ |access-date=December 31, 2024 |website=The Washington Post |language=en |issn=0190-8286}}</ref>

title: Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign
deleted: {{cite news |author=Ray |first=Siladitya |date=June 14, 2024 |title=Trump Says He Had A Speech 'Rewritten By AI' And Decided 'I'm Going To Use This' |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/siladityaray/2024/06/14/trump-says-he-had-a-speech-rewritten-by-ai-and-decided-im-going-to-use-this |url-access=subscription |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250318174802/https://www.forbes.com/sites/siladityaray/2024/06/14/trump-says-he-had-a-speech-rewritten-by-ai-and-decided-im-going-to-use-this/ |archive-date=March 18, 2025 |access-date=April 20, 2025 |website=[[Forbes]]}}
